# Image Replacement Guide

This directory contains placeholder files for all images used in the website. Replace these files with the actual images from your Figma design.

## Image Files and Specifications

### Header & Branding
- **`OIAD.png`**
  - Location: Header
  - Recommended size: 250px × 69px
  - Format: PNG
  - Description: OIAD company logo

- **`OIAD-icon.png`**
  - Location: Global navigation (top bar)
  - Recommended size: 80px × 77px
  - Format: PNG
  - Description: OIAD icon/logo for global nav

### Hero Section
- **`hero-resistance-bands.jpg`** or **`hero-resistance-bands.png`**
  - Location: Hero section background
  - Recommended size: 1920px × 802px (full width)
  - Format: JPG for photos, PNG if transparency needed
  - Description: Woman with obesity with resistance bands holding her in place, attached to the words "The Body Can Resist Weight Loss"
  - Important: High quality image, optimized for web

### Not Your Fault Section
- **`yellow-bar-background.jpg`** or **`yellow-bar-background.png`**
  - Location: "It's not your fault" section background
  - Recommended size: 1920px × 648px (full width)
  - Format: JPG preferred
  - Description: Yellow/orange gradient or abstract design background
  - Note: Should complement the text overlay

### Impact Section
- **`man-frustrated-obesity.jpg`** or **`man-frustrated-obesity.png`**
  - Location: Impact section (left side of two-column layout)
  - Recommended size: 608px height (width flexible for aspect ratio)
  - Format: JPG for photos
  - Description: A man with obesity standing with a frustrated expression
  - Important: Should be high quality and respectful

### Footer
- **`OIAD-logo-footer.png`**
  - Location: Footer
  - Recommended size: 98px × 45px
  - Format: PNG
  - Description: OIAD logo for footer

### Social Media Icons (Optional - currently using text placeholders)
If you want to use actual icon images instead of text:

- **`icon-facebook.png`** - 24px × 24px
- **`icon-twitter.png`** - 24px × 24px
- **`icon-linkedin.png`** - 24px × 24px
- **`icon-youtube.png`** - 24px × 24px

## Image Optimization Tips

1. **Compress all images** before uploading to reduce page load time
2. **Use appropriate format**:
   - PNG for logos and icons (with transparency)
   - JPG for photographs
   - WebP for best compression (with fallbacks)
3. **Provide retina versions** (@2x) for high-DPI displays
4. **Optimize PNG files** using tools like TinyPNG or ImageOptim

## Accessibility Requirements

All images should have appropriate alt text defined in the component files. Make sure images are:
- High contrast
- Clear and not pixelated
- Respectful and appropriate
- WCAG AA compliant

## File Naming Convention

- Use lowercase
- Use hyphens (not underscores) to separate words
- Be descriptive
- Include dimension suffixes for retina images (e.g., `logo@2x.png`)

## Next Steps

1. Export images from Figma at the recommended sizes
2. Optimize images using tools like:
   - TinyPNG (https://tinypng.com/)
   - ImageOptim (https://imageoptim.com/)
   - Squoosh (https://squoosh.app/)
3. Replace the placeholder files in this directory
4. Update component files if different filenames are used
